s.text: Some blame a shaky translation from the original Polish; others say the author's use of so many varying literary devices and styles squelches the heart of the novel: "Only a spark of life survives its mannerisms" (Richard Eder, the Los Angeles Times ). (Read the first chapter here.)
This Primary Colors -type story of a president who has an affair with a young staffer was written by a former Clinton speechwriter.
Book --The Vintner's Luck , by Elizabeth Knox.
